full_summary:
### Oral History Research Project – Prince Albert National Park

### Tender Overview

The Parks Canada Agency is seeking a contractor to conduct an oral history research project to delve deeper into the multi-generational impact of the establishment of Prince Albert National Park on local Indigenous communities.

### Project Description

The project requires the contractor to research and analyze historical data, original research, and local knowledge to create a public history document approximately 30 pages in length. The document will detail the impact of the park's establishment on local Indigenous communities, relationships with the land, and family connections. Emphasis will be placed on centering oral history evidence at the forefront of the narrative.

To supplement the research, the contractor will conduct meetings with community members to gather local knowledge, history, and modern photographs and maps incorporating names to better situate narratives.

### Period of Contract / Delivery Date

The period of the contract is from the contract start date to September 30, 2023, inclusive.

### Tender Documents

All tender documents are available on the Government Electronic Tendering Service through the Government of Canada tendering service at [canadabuy.ca](http://canadabuy.ca).
